intro: Psychotria micrococca, commonly known as the dwarf coffee plant, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil and Peru. The plant is characterized by its small, dark green leaves and clusters of small, white flowers. It produces red berries that contain seeds, which are dispersed by birds. Psychotria micrococca is often found in moist, shaded environments within tropical rainforests.
